members.name: transparentImageData
members.doc: The data URI of a transparent image. May be used e.g. in HTML as an image source or in CSS in url().
members.short_doc: The data URI of a transparent image. ...

members.name: addFunction
members.doc:
Creates a function reference that can be called later using callFunction. This approach is especially useful to make DOM attribute function calls to JavaScript-defined functions.

var ref = CKEDITOR.tools.addFunction( function() {
    alert( 'Hello!');
} );
CKEDITOR.tools.callFunction( ref ); // 'Hello!'

params.name: fn
params.doc: The function to be executed on call.

params.name: scope
params.doc: The object to have the context on fn execution.

return.name: return
return.doc: A unique reference to be used in conjuction with callFunction.

members.short_doc:
Creates a function reference that can be called later using
callFunction. ...

members.name: arrayCompare
members.doc:
Compares the elements of two arrays.

var a = [ 1, 'a', 3 ];
var b = [ 1, 3, 'a' ];
var c = [ 1, 'a', 3 ];
var d = [ 1, 'a', 3, 4 ];

alert( CKEDITOR.tools.arrayCompare( a, b ) );  // false
alert( CKEDITOR.tools.arrayCompare( a, c ) );  // true
alert( CKEDITOR.tools.arrayCompare( a, d ) );  // false

return.name: return
return.doc: true if the arrays have the same length and their elements match.

members.short_doc: Compares the elements of two arrays. ...

members.name: bind
members.doc:
Creates a function that will always execute in the context of a specified object.

var obj = { text: 'My Object' };

function alertText() {
    alert( this.text );
}

var newFunc = CKEDITOR.tools.bind( alertText, obj );
newFunc(); // Alerts 'My Object'.

params.name: obj
params.doc: The object to which the execution context will be bound.

return.name: return
return.doc: The function that can be used to execute the func function in the context of obj.

members.short_doc:
Creates a function that will always execute in the context of a
specified object. ...

members.name: buildStyleHtml
members.doc: Builds a HTML snippet from a set of <style>/<link>.

params.name: css
params.doc: Each of which are URLs (absolute) of a CSS file or a trunk of style text.

members.short_doc: Builds a HTML snippet from a set of <style>/<link>. ...

members.name: callFunction
members.doc:
Executes a function based on the reference created with addFunction.

var ref = CKEDITOR.tools.addFunction( function() {
    alert( 'Hello!');
} );
CKEDITOR.tools.callFunction( ref ); // 'Hello!'

params.name: ref
params.doc: The function reference created with addFunction.

params.name: params
params.doc: Any number of parameters to be passed to the executed function.

members.short_doc: Executes a function based on the reference created with addFunction. ...

members.name: capitalize
members.doc: Turns the first letter of a string to upper-case.

params.name: keepCase
params.doc: Keep the case of 2nd to last letter.

members.short_doc: Turns the first letter of a string to upper-case. ...

members.name: checkIfAnyArrayItemMatches
members.doc: Checks if any of the arr items match the provided regular expression.

return.name: return
return.doc: Returns true for the first occurrence of the search pattern.

members.short_doc: Checks if any of the arr items match the provided regular expression. ...

members.name: checkIfAnyObjectPropertyMatches
members.doc: Checks if any of the obj properties match the provided regular expression.

params.doc: The object whose properties will be checked.

return.name: return
return.doc: Returns true for the first occurrence of the search pattern.

members.short_doc: Checks if any of the obj properties match the provided regular expression. ...

members.name: clone
members.doc:
Creates a deep copy of an object.

Note: Recursive references are not supported.

var obj = {
    name: 'John',
    cars: {
        Mercedes: { color: 'blue' },
        Porsche: { color: 'red' }
    }
};
var clone = CKEDITOR.tools.clone( obj );
clone.name = 'Paul';
clone.cars.Porsche.color = 'silver';

alert( obj.name );                  // 'John'
alert( clone.name );                // 'Paul'
alert( obj.cars.Porsche.color );    // 'red'
alert( clone.cars.Porsche.color );  // 'silver'
members.short_doc: Creates a deep copy of an object. ...

members.name: convertArrayToObject
members.doc:
Converts an array to an object by rewriting array items to object properties.

var arr = [ 'foo', 'bar', 'foo' ];
console.log( CKEDITOR.tools.convertArrayToObject( arr ) );
// -> { foo: true, bar: true }
console.log( CKEDITOR.tools.convertArrayToObject( arr, 1 ) );
// -> { foo: 1, bar: 1 }

params.name: arr
params.doc: The array to be converted to an object.

params.name: fillWith
params.doc: Set each property of an object to fillWith value.

members.short_doc:
Converts an array to an object by rewriting array items
to object properties. ...

members.name: convertRgbToHex
members.doc: Finds and converts rgb(x,x,x) color definition to hexadecimal notation.

params.name: styleText
params.doc: The style data (or just a string containing RGB colors) to be converted.

return.name: return
return.doc: The style data with RGB colors converted to hexadecimal equivalents.

members.short_doc: Finds and converts rgb(x,x,x) color definition to hexadecimal notation. ...

members.name: convertToPx
members.doc:
Converts the specified CSS length value to the calculated pixel length inside this page.

Note: Percentage-based value is left intact.
members.short_doc: Converts the specified CSS length value to the calculated pixel length inside this page. ...

members.name: copy
members.doc: Makes fast (shallow) copy of an object. This method is faster than clone which does a deep copy of an object (including arrays).
members.short_doc: Makes fast (shallow) copy of an object. ...

members.name: createClass
members.doc:
Class creation based on prototype inheritance which supports of the following features:

  • Static fields
  • Private fields
  • Public (prototype) fields
  • Chainable base class constructor
members.short_doc:
Class creation based on prototype inheritance which supports of the
following features:


Static fields
Private field...

members.name: cssLength
members.doc:
Appends the px length unit to the size value if it is missing.

var cssLength = CKEDITOR.tools.cssLength;
cssLength( 42 );        // '42px'
cssLength( '42' );      // '42px'
cssLength( '42px' );    // '42px'
cssLength( '42%' );     // '42%'
cssLength( 'bold' );    // 'bold'
cssLength( false );     // ''
cssLength( NaN );       // ''
members.short_doc: Appends the px length unit to the size value if it is missing. ...

members.name: cssStyleToDomStyle
members.doc:
Transforms a CSS property name to its relative DOM style name.

alert( CKEDITOR.tools.cssStyleToDomStyle( 'background-color' ) );   // 'backgroundColor'
alert( CKEDITOR.tools.cssStyleToDomStyle( 'float' ) );              // 'cssFloat'
members.short_doc: Transforms a CSS property name to its relative DOM style name. ...

members.name: cssVendorPrefix
members.doc:
Generates an object or a string containing vendor-specific and vendor-free CSS properties.

CKEDITOR.tools.cssVendorPrefix( 'border-radius', '0', true );
// On Firefox: '-moz-border-radius:0;border-radius:0'
// On Chrome: '-webkit-border-radius:0;border-radius:0'

params.name: asString
params.doc: If true, then the returned value will be a CSS string.

return.name: return
return.doc: The object containing CSS properties or its stringified version.

members.short_doc: Generates an object or a string containing vendor-specific and vendor-free CSS properties. ...

members.name: defer
members.doc:
Creates a "deferred" function which will not run immediately, but rather runs as soon as the interpreter’s call stack is empty. Behaves much like window.setTimeout with a delay.

Note: The return value of the original function will be lost.
members.short_doc:
Creates a "deferred" function which will not run immediately,
but rather runs as soon as the interpreter’s call stack...

members.name: enableHtml5Elements
members.doc:
Enables HTML5 elements for older browsers (IE8) in the passed document.

In IE8 this method can also be executed on a document fragment.

Note: This method has to be used in the <head> section of the document.

params.name: doc
params.doc: Native Document or DocumentFragment in which the elements will be enabled.

params.name: withAppend
params.doc: Whether to append created elements to the doc.

members.short_doc: Enables HTML5 elements for older browsers (IE8) in the passed document. ...

members.name: eventsBuffer
members.doc:
Buffers input events (or any input calls) and triggers output not more often than once per minInterval.

var buffer = CKEDITOR.tools.eventsBuffer( 200, function() {
    console.log( 'foo!' );
} );

buffer.input();
// 'foo!' logged immediately.
buffer.input();
// Nothing logged.
buffer.input();
// Nothing logged.
// ... after 200ms a single 'foo!' will be logged.

Can be easily used with events:

var buffer = CKEDITOR.tools.eventsBuffer( 200, function() {
    console.log( 'foo!' );
} );

editor.on( 'key', buffer.input );
// Note: There is no need to bind buffer as a context.

properties.name: reset
properties.doc: Resets buffered events — output will not be executed until next input is triggered.

members.short_doc:
Buffers input events (or any input calls)
and triggers output not more often than once per minInterval. ...

members.name: extend
members.doc:
Copies the properties from one object to another. By default, properties already present in the target object are not overwritten.

// Create the sample object.
var myObject = {
    prop1: true
};

// Extend the above object with two properties.
CKEDITOR.tools.extend( myObject, {
    prop2: true,
    prop3: true
} );

// Alert 'prop1', 'prop2' and 'prop3'.
for ( var p in myObject )
    alert( p );

params.name: source
params.doc: The object(s) from properties will be copied. Any number of objects can be passed to this function.

params.name: overwrite
params.doc: If true is specified, it indicates that properties already present in the target object could be overwritten by subsequent objects.

params.name: properties
params.doc: Only properties within the specified names list will be received from the source object.

members.short_doc: Copies the properties from one object to another. ...

members.name: fixDomain
members.doc: Tries to fix the document.domain of the current document to match the parent window domain, avoiding "Same Origin" policy issues. This is an Internet Explorer only requirement.

return.name: return
return.doc: true if the current domain is already good or if it has been fixed successfully.

members.short_doc:
Tries to fix the document.domain of the current document to match the
parent window domain, avoiding "Same Origin" po...

members.name: genKey
members.doc:
Generates a combined key from a series of params.

var key = CKEDITOR.tools.genKey( 'key1', 'key2', 'key3' );
alert( key ); // 'key1-key2-key3'.

params.name: subKey
params.doc: One or more strings used as subkeys.

members.short_doc: Generates a combined key from a series of params. ...

members.name: getNextId
members.doc:
Gets a unique ID for CKEditor interface elements. It returns a string with the "cke_" prefix and a consecutive number.

alert( CKEDITOR.tools.getNextId() ); // (e.g.) 'cke_1'
alert( CKEDITOR.tools.getNextId() ); // 'cke_2'
members.short_doc: Gets a unique ID for CKEditor interface elements. ...

members.name: getNextNumber
members.doc:
Gets a unique number for this CKEDITOR execution session. It returns consecutive numbers starting from 1.

alert( CKEDITOR.tools.getNextNumber() ); // (e.g.) 1
alert( CKEDITOR.tools.getNextNumber() ); // 2
members.short_doc: Gets a unique number for this CKEDITOR execution session. ...

members.name: htmlDecode
members.doc:
Decodes HTML entities.

alert( CKEDITOR.tools.htmlDecode( '<a & b >' ) ); // '<a & b >'
members.short_doc: Decodes HTML entities. ...

members.name: htmlDecodeAttr
members.doc:
Replace HTML entities previously encoded by htmlEncodeAttr back to their plain character representation.

alert( CKEDITOR.tools.htmlDecodeAttr( '<a " b>' ) ); // '<a " b>'
members.short_doc:
Replace HTML entities previously encoded by
htmlEncodeAttr back to their plain character
representation. ...

members.name: htmlEncode
members.doc:
Replaces special HTML characters in a string with their relative HTML entity values.

alert( CKEDITOR.tools.htmlEncode( 'A > B & C < D' ) ); // 'A > B & C < D'
members.short_doc:
Replaces special HTML characters in a string with their relative HTML
entity values. ...

members.name: htmlEncodeAttr
members.doc:
Replaces special HTML characters in HTMLElement attribute with their relative HTML entity values.

alert( CKEDITOR.tools.htmlEncodeAttr( '<a " b >' ) ); // '<a " b >'
members.short_doc: Replaces special HTML characters in HTMLElement attribute with their relative HTML entity values. ...

members.name: indexOf
members.doc:
Returns the index of an element in an array.

var letters = [ 'a', 'b', 0, 'c', false ];
alert( CKEDITOR.tools.indexOf( letters, '0' ) );        // -1 because 0 !== '0'
alert( CKEDITOR.tools.indexOf( letters, false ) );      // 4 because 0 !== false

params.name: value
params.doc: The element to be found. This can be an evaluation function which receives a single parameter call for each entry in the array, returning true if the entry matches.

return.name: return
return.doc: The (zero-based) index of the first entry that matches the entry, or -1 if not found.

members.short_doc: Returns the index of an element in an array. ...

members.name: isArray
members.doc:
Checks if an object is an Array.

alert( CKEDITOR.tools.isArray( [] ) );      // true
alert( CKEDITOR.tools.isArray( 'Test' ) );  // false

return.name: return
return.doc: true if the object is an Array, otherwise false.

members.short_doc: Checks if an object is an Array. ...

members.name: isEmpty
members.doc: Whether the object contains no properties of its own.
members.short_doc: Whether the object contains no properties of its own. ...

members.name: ltrim
members.doc:
Removes spaces from the start (left) of a string. The following characters are removed: space, tab, line break, line feed.

alert( CKEDITOR.tools.ltrim( '  example ' ); // 'example '

params.name: str
params.doc: The text from which the spaces will be removed.

return.name: return
return.doc: The modified string excluding the removed spaces.

members.short_doc: Removes spaces from the start (left) of a string. ...

members.name: normalizeCssText
members.doc: Normalizes CSS data in order to avoid differences in the style attribute.
members.short_doc: Normalizes CSS data in order to avoid differences in the style attribute. ...

Compares two objects.

Note: This method performs shallow, non-strict comparison.

params.name: onlyLeft
params.doc: Check only the properties that are present in the left object.

members.name: objectKeys
members.doc:
Returns an array of passed object's keys.

console.log( CKEDITOR.tools.objectKeys( { foo: 1, bar: false } );
// -> [ 'foo', 'bar' ]
members.short_doc: Returns an array of passed object's keys. ...

members.name: override
members.doc:
Creates a function override.

var obj = {
    myFunction: function( name ) {
        alert( 'Name: ' + name );
    }
};

obj.myFunction = CKEDITOR.tools.override( obj.myFunction, function( myFunctionOriginal ) {
    return function( name ) {
        alert( 'Overriden name: ' + name );
        myFunctionOriginal.call( this, name );
    };
} );

params.name: functionBuilder
params.doc: A function that returns the new function. The original function reference will be passed to this function.

members.short_doc: Creates a function override. ...

members.name: parseCssText

params.name: normalize
params.doc: Normalize properties and values (e.g. trim spaces, convert to lower case).

members.short_doc: Turns inline style text properties into one hash. ...

members.name: prototypedCopy
members.doc: Creates an object which is an instance of a class whose prototype is a predefined object. All properties defined in the source object are automatically inherited by the resulting object, including future changes to it.

params.name: source
params.doc: The source object to be used as the prototype for the final object.

members.name: rtrim
members.doc:
Removes spaces from the end (right) of a string. The following characters are removed: space, tab, line break, line feed.

alert( CKEDITOR.tools.ltrim( '  example ' ); // '  example'

params.name: str
params.doc: The text from which spaces will be removed.

return.name: return
return.doc: The modified string excluding the removed spaces.

members.short_doc: Removes spaces from the end (right) of a string. ...

members.name: search
members.doc:
Returns the index of an element in an array.

var obj = { prop: true };
var letters = [ 'a', 'b', 0, obj, false ];

alert( CKEDITOR.tools.indexOf( letters, '0' ) ); // null
alert( CKEDITOR.tools.indexOf( letters, function( value ) {
    // Return true when passed value has property 'prop'.
    return value && 'prop' in value;
} ) );                                          // obj

params.name: value
params.doc: The element to be found. Can be an evaluation function which receives a single parameter call for each entry in the array, returning true if the entry matches.

return.name: return
return.doc: Object The value that was found in an array.

members.short_doc: Returns the index of an element in an array. ...

members.name: setTimeout
members.doc:
Executes a function after specified delay.

CKEDITOR.tools.setTimeout( function() {
    alert( 'Executed after 2 seconds' );
}, 2000 );

params.name: milliseconds
params.doc: The amount of time (in millisecods) to wait to fire the function execution.

params.name: scope
params.doc: The object to store the function execution scope (the this object).

params.name: args
params.doc: A single object, or an array of objects, to pass as argument to the function.

params.name: ownerWindow
params.doc: The window that will be used to set the timeout.

return.name: return
return.doc: A value that can be used to cancel the function execution.

members.short_doc: Executes a function after specified delay. ...

members.name: trim
members.doc:
Removes spaces from the start and the end of a string. The following characters are removed: space, tab, line break, line feed.

alert( CKEDITOR.tools.trim( '  example ' ); // 'example'

params.name: str
params.doc: The text from which the spaces will be removed.

return.name: return
return.doc: The modified string without the boundary spaces.

members.short_doc: Removes spaces from the start and the end of a string. ...

members.name: tryThese
members.doc: Returns the first successfully executed return value of a function that does not throw any exception.
members.short_doc:
Returns the first successfully executed return value of a function that
does not throw any exception. ...

members.name: writeCssText
members.doc:
Serializes the style name => value hash to a style text.

var styleObj = CKEDITOR.tools.parseCssText( 'color: red; border: none' );
console.log( styleObj.color ); // -> 'red'
CKEDITOR.tools.writeCssText( styleObj ); // -> 'color:red; border:none'
CKEDITOR.tools.writeCssText( styleObj, true ); // -> 'border:none; color:red'
members.short_doc: Serializes the style name => value hash to a style text. ...
